abstract: Evgeny Buryakov, Igor Sporyshev, and Victor Podobnyy are arrested on charges of serving as secret agents for Russia while working in New York; federal authorities believe that men were directed to collect intelligence on potential United States sanctions against Russian Federation and on US efforts to develop alternative energy resources.
lead_paragraph: Two of the men were posing as official representatives of Russia, but they gave assignments to a third man, federal officials say.
snippet: Two of the men were posing as official representatives of Russia, but they gave assignments to a third man, federal officials say.

headline.main: 3 Men Are Charged With Serving as Secret Agents for Russia in New York
headline.print_headline: 3 Men Are Charged With Serving as Secret Agents for Russia in New York
